info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 24 at 5:11PM PDT until August 24 at 8:15PM PDT by NWS Elko NV
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of north central Nevada, including the following county, Lander.
* WHEN...Until 815 PM PDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 511 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is already occurring around New Pass Summit on US Highway 50. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - New Pass Summit on US Highway 50 is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 0.4 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... New Pass Summit. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM PDT THIS EVENING
